page.title: 13Chalton Village
page.content: In Chalton there are 185 houses,some small,others large.One of the oldest houses in Chalton is{Costelow house. The exact dates are not known,but it is thought to have been built around 1540.The house was derelict until after the war.Until a builder restored Costelow house,only one room was safe. Costelow house is now occupied by the Willons.Up until 1950,Chalton was quite a small village.During the '60s the turning point began,starting with Chalton Heights.After Chalton Heights was taken down ,so were many others.These were replaced by modern houses.In Chalton there are strange looking bungalows.The bricks which the house were made of are Caddington greys.They have a distinctive{ABC marked on them,this stands for{ALFRED {BIRD CHALTON.
